intro: Pyrus ferax, commonly known as the wild pear, is a species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a deciduous tree that typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters, featuring smooth, grayish-brown bark and alternate, simple leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in the spring, which are followed by edible, yellow or orange pomes. Its fruits are often used in traditional medicine and can be fermented into alcoholic beverages. Pyrus ferax is adapted to harsh climates and is often found in rocky or arid environments.
